nodes.text: The Coral Coast of Ord Mantell was the shorelines that spread out southeast of the capital city of Worlport.

Known as the Coral Coast to residents and visitors alike, the shoreline was dotted by debris washed up from millennia of a lack of environmental protections placed on industry. Scavenger communities from the Breakwater sailed across Worlport Bay to reach the coastlines and salvage any useful junk.
